Text.val: Author: Christian Overhoff
Creation: 17.02.2005
This module is the entry point of CreditMan. The user has to input the user, of
which he wants to handle the debtors
or he has to type in a debtor itself.
He can search for a debtor in a selection list, or he can find the last handled
18.12.2013 SH SCR18565 Adjusted argument list for ODHC01
08.03.2013 GB SCR17995 Replaced screen button load logic by GB901
04.04.2012 SH SCR17182 Replaced GM900 by GB900 (program permission)
27.11.2009 AK SCR15041 Restore default coordinates when corrupted
14.11.2008 GB SCR14092 Added task GetAndSaveWindowPosition
26.07.2007 SH SCR11925 Adjusted argument list of client selection program
Shortcut labels:
Control the users rights for this modul:
If user has at least Query right --> proceed, otherwise program is stopped:
To be able to see, if menue "CredMan" must start this task simply
or a second session has to be started,
it's necessary to be able to see, if CredMan screen is open already
Program starts as if OK-Button would have been hit (default start):
Get department of current login user:
Shortcut handling:
-- Get window position
:End: User has Query rights
Default User input:
Delete empty window record, just in case:
Start interface:
User was selected:
Initialize all screen fields again:
Stop process afterwards...:
No user selected, but specific debtor client was selected:
Debtor was selected:
Initialize all screen fields again:
Stop process afterwards:
No user selected and no specific debtor client specified:
Show selection list of all debtors in question:
If a specific debtor was selected, handle it now:
Initialize all screen fields again:
After handling stop the process:
:End: Ok-Button
"Emergency exit": If another menue was called,
then this task has to stop in any case:
initialize user field with user(0) again...:
... and delete all debtor fields:
-- set
-- get

Comment.val:
Open questions:
What does the validation on USR_ID mean? What is in the file CRCL?
Do ALL Debtor fields to be filled out, or can ANY (="a combination") be filled?

Text.val: If the user was changed, than delete all debtor fields (if any);
:End: if user was changed
:End: User

is done by Control Verification Handler starting a subtask
one time after all 4 fields are typed in (due to performance):

The debtor flags need to be refreshed to be sure of present values:
In case the user hits Ok without any change, he has accepted
the default user-id on screen (but Record Suffix wouldn't be executed,
so the update has to be done here instead!)
After changing any input field on the screen (and after having
entered all fields) this task updates all flags related to that changes.
Found 1 unique debtor:

no specific debtor to save for passing to the next module:
